meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inviable.
meanings.sent1: The inviability of the seed prevented it from sprouting.
meanings.sent2: The inviability of the plan led to its failure.
meanings.sent3: The inviability of the cake recipe made it a disaster.
meanings.sent4: The inviability of the relationship was evident from the start.
meanings.sent5: The inviability of the bridge was a major concern for the engineers.

meanings.definition: The inability to survive or develop.
meanings.sent1: The inviability of the species threatened its existence.
meanings.sent2: The inviability of the project halted its progress.
meanings.sent3: The inviability of the phone battery made for a frustrating day.
meanings.sent4: The inviability of the idea stifled its potential growth.
meanings.sent5: The inviability of the plant in the harsh climate was evident.
